contentrichtext.text: {{about|the Sichuanese immortals||Eight Immortals (disambiguation)}} {{chinesetext}} '''Eight Immortals from [[Sichuan]]''' ({{zh|c=蜀中八仙|p=Shǔ zhōng bāxiān}}) are eight Sichuanese who supposedly became ''[[Xian (Daoist)| xian]]'' ("immortals; transcendents; fairies"). The term is first used by [[Qiao Xiu]] (譙秀 qiáo xiù) in ''Record of [[Shu (kingdom)|Shu]]'' (《蜀紀》 shǔ zì) written in [[Jin Dynasty (265-420)|Jin Dynasty]]. They are: * [[Fan Changsheng]] (范長生 fàn cháng shēng), * [[Dong Zhongshu]] (董仲舒 dǒng zhòng shū), * [[Li Babai]] (李八百 lǐ bā baǐ), * [[Li Er]] (李耳 lǐ ěr), * [[Master Erzhu]] (爾朱先生 ěr zhū xiān shēn), * [[Mister Rongcheng]] (容成公 róng chéng gōng), * [[Zhang Daoling]] (張道陵 zhāng dào līng), and * [[Zhuang Junping]] (莊君平 zhuāng jūn píng). [[Category:Cultural lists|8 Eight Immortals from Sichuan]] [[Category:Articles about multiple people]] [[Category:Sichuan]]
